snippet: The Red River Women’s Clinic, in Fargo, argues that requiring its doctors to have local admitting privileges would effectively put it out of business.
abstract: North Dakota's sole abortion provider is suing state to block new law that it says could force it to shut down; law, which requires doctors performing abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospital, may impinge on clinic's reliance on out of state doctors.
lead_paragraph: The Red River Women’s Clinic, in Fargo, argues that requiring its doctors to have local admitting privileges would effectively put it out of business.

headline.seo: North Dakota’s Sole Abortion Clinic Sues to Block New Law
headline.main: North Dakota’s Sole Abortion Clinic Sues to Block New Law
headline.print_headline: North Dakota’s Sole Abortion Clinic Sues to Block New Law
